org.fluidity.foundation.spi

Interface LogFactory

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    NoLogFactory

    public interface LogFactory
    Adapts an external logging framework to the Fluid Tools dependency injection system. This interface is used only by implementations of such an adaptor. For logging in your code, see to the documentation of the Log class.

    The log factory creates source-bound Log objects. Your implementation should adapt the respective log sink of the logging framework of your choice to the Log interface. The prevalent implementation of this interface will be looked for as a JAR Service Provider.

    You will need to use Fluid Tools to implement and build your adaptor, and annotate the implementation with both @ServiceProvider and @Component. The Java archive containing the implementation must be in the class path for it to be found and used, and it must be the only archive in the class path that contains a LogFactory implementation.

    See LogAdapter for a recommended way to adapt any logging framework to Fluid Tools.

    Log objects returned by this factory are thread safe as long as the underlying log implementation is.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      <T> Log<T> createLog(Class<T> source)
      Creates a log whose output is annotated by the given class.
      Class<?> type()
      Returns the class of the instantiated Log implementation.

    • Method Detail

      • type

        Class<?> type()
        Returns the class of the instantiated Log implementation.
        Returns:
        a class object; never null.

      • createLog

        <T> Log<T> createLog(Class<T> source)
        Creates a log whose output is annotated by the given class.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the given source class to which the returned Log instance belongs.
        Parameters:
        source - the class to annotate log messages with.
        Returns:
        a log sink.
